Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Eric Turner, Associate Minister, St. Luke A.M.E. Church, 1854 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY 10031.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Jackson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Eric Turner, Associate Minister, St. Luke A.M.E. Church, 1854 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10031.

Council Member Jackson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 080287 PQK, an acquisition of property, shall be subject to Council review. This application is related to application no. C 080288 HAK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, 924 & 928 Madison St.; 1023, 1013, 1007, 1052 & 1054 Putnam Ave., Brooklyn (C080278HAK)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 402 West 47th Street, Community Board 4, Application 20085252 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, Pam Real Thai II Inc., Manhattan (20085252TCM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 070175 ZSQ, C070178 ZSQ, and C 060278 MMQ shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to application no. C 070174 ZMQ that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, College Point Holdings I, LLC (C2070178ZSQ)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law in relation to renaming six thoroughfares in the Borough of Queens, Burlingham Court, James Court, McKee Avenue, Calhoun Road, Moncriff Drive and Lockwood Court, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Street Name Changes, Six thoroughfares in Queens

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the state and federal governments to use public funds to insure the unemployed and other vulnerable groups without health insurance.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Use public funds to insure the unemployed and other vulnerable groups without health insurance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the consolidation of the environmental control board with the office of administrative trials and hearings and replacing the commissioner of consumer affairs with the chief administrative law judge of the office of administrative trials and hearings on the environmental control board and making other changes related thereto.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Consolidation of the environmental control board with the office of administrative trials and hearings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation the operation of gasoline-powered leaf and garden blowers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Operation of gasoline-powered leaf and garden blowers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, Senate bill S.8235, and its Assembly companion bill A.11097, known as the Rent Board Reform Act of 2008.

Items.MatterName: Rent Board Reform Act of 2008.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regionally significant projects and empire zones.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Bicycle parking in garage and parking lots.

Items.MatterName: Mandating that the commissioner of the fire department promulgate rules requiring certain building owners to place photoluminescent apartment numbers on apartment doors.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).


(Consistent within the nature of a recessed meeting, Council Members Dickens, Palma, and Sanders are considered Present for this Meeting; these 3 Council Members were absent from the Stated Meeting which was held on May 28, 2008 but were present for the brief Recessed Council Meeting of May 28, 2008 held on June 12, 2008 --these 3 Council Members are,  therefore,  considered Present for attendance purposes and Present but Not Voting for voting purposes in regard to the May 28, 2008 Stated Council Meeting)
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:
At the request of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn). the Public Advocate delared the Meeting to be in recess.

Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2008 to implement changes to the City’s expense budget. (MN -2)

Items.Title: Application no. 20085592 PNK pursuant to §1301(2)(f) and (g) of the New York City Charter concerning the proposed maritime lease at the South Brooklyn Marine Terminal between the Department of Small Business Services and Sims Municipal Recycling of New York LLC.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
